5c698248-2216-4da7-aaf5-52ce30eab2c6.description: Students are nominated by Bucks County Community College for membership based on academic standing and leadership potential. The NSLS provides a step-by-step program for members to build their leadership skills. Upon completion of the program, members are formally inducted and receive their leadership certificate.
5c698248-2216-4da7-aaf5-52ce30eab2c6.name: Inducted Member of The National Society of Leadership and Success

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Provide life-time guaranteed membership fee to The National Society of Leadership and Success.
3.2 GPA
6 credits (or more) course work.
Attend an orientation and learn the steps of the leadership development program and the schedule of events for the semester.
Attend leadership training day to learn to identify goals and overcome obstacles and to identify true passions and strengths while creating action steps to achieve goals.

Attend three speaker broadcast events with leaders, celebrities and best-selling authors. Topics include leadership, identifying goals, facing challenges, personal growth, and successfully transitioning from college to career.
Participate in three team meetings to set goals for future success, to practice accountability, and to reflect on the team experience.

Bucks County Community College holds a formal induction ceremony which can be shared with family and friends. At this ceremony, students are presented with their Certificate of Leadership Training honoring their achievement and membership in the NSLS.

71de17b3-88c0-4af5-998a-663a62cde14a.description: The Program introduces participants to the fundamental concepts and skills required to be a machinist in the field of advanced manufacturing. Topics include measurement tools and systems, blueprint reading, safety, hand tools, manual machines, CNC machining, welding, and shop math and measurement. Students can sit for the National Institute for Metalworking Skills (NIMS) exam for Measurement, Materials, and Safety Certification.
71de17b3-88c0-4af5-998a-663a62cde14a.name: Pre-Apprenticeship Metalwork

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: High School Diploma or GED

Entry requirements into program include passing a vigorous application process including aptitude test, interview screening, background checks are evaluated on a case by case basis, and drug tests are pass/fail with no exceptions.
OSHA 10-Hour: General Industry
Forklift Safety Training

Hand Tool Use:  24-hours – Students gain an entry-level understanding of all hand tools associated with advanced manufacturing. Students have access to all basic hand tools and benchwork in order to understand which tool is right and safest for every job. Tools run the gamut of all facets of manufacturing so students will be able to work in shops throughout the industry.

Shop Math and Measurement: 54-hours – Students learn the basics of measurement, the English and metric systems as well as basic trigonometry, and learn to use measuring tools. Students sit for the National Institute for Metalworking Skills (NIMS) exam for Measurement, Materials and Safety Certification at the end of the course based on skills learned partly in this section.

Blueprint Reading and AutoCAD: 57-hours – Students gain an entry-level understanding of blue print reading and AutoCAD. Students understand all notes, abbreviations and symbols and learn to read and intercept drawings. Additionally, they learn to map 2D and 3D drawings with AutoCAD software.

Machining: 60-hours – Students gain an entry-level understanding of machining. Instruction is both academic and hands-on, including but not limited to: grinding, band saw and blades, drill press, lathes, milling machines and CNC machining.  Students demonstrate ability to operate all of the above listed machines and have a basic understanding of machine programming and coding where appropriate.

Welding:  42-hours – Students gain an entry-level understanding of welding and plasma cutting. Instruction begins on a welding simulator and eventually graduates to hands-on welding where students learn stick and MIG welding. Students are trained in safety procedures associated with welding and leave with an understanding of how to complete a weld from start to finish.

Workplace and Employability Skills: 12-hours – Students work with a career coach/job developer to learn employability skills. Specifically, students work to develop a resume and hone their interviewing skills. Students are coached through employer interviews and ultimately placed in a job or apprenticeship upon graduating the program.

Personal Finance: 3 hours – Students learn the importance of budgeting, saving and managing their finances. Students learn how to manage their own personal budgets and gain a better understanding of financially planning for the future.

3ff97578-570f-49ba-9495-e25bf8cfba48.description: This program introduces students to the fundamental concepts and skills required by electro-mechanical technicians in manufacturing and a variety of industries. Coursework includes Safety, Shop Math and Measurement, Blueprint Reading, Basic Electricity (AC/DC Circuits), Electrical Fabrication, Mechanical Fabrication, Hydraulic & Pneumatic Basics, Troubleshooting, Electric Relay Control concepts and Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs).
3ff97578-570f-49ba-9495-e25bf8cfba48.name: Pre-Apprenticeship Industrial Maintenance

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: High School Diploma or GED

Entry requirements into program include passing a vigorous application process including aptitude test, interview screening, background checks are evaluated on a case by case basis, and drug tests are pass/fail with no exceptions.
OSHA 10-Hour: General Industry
Forklift Safety Training

Shop Math and Measurement: 48-hours - Students learn the basics of measurement, the English and metric systems as well as basic geometry and trigonometry. Students define and discuss measurement types, tolerance and are introduced to the concept of inspection, quality control and classes of fits.

Blueprint Reading: 36-hours – Students gain an entry-level understanding of blue print reading. Students learn all notes, abbreviations, symbols and types of views. Students learn to read and intercept drawings. Additionally, they learn the basics of GD&T.

Workplace and Employability Skills:  12-hours – Students work with a career coach/job developer to learn employability skills. Specifically, students work to develop a resume and hone their interviewing skills. Students are coached through employer interviews and ultimately placed in a job or apprenticeship upon graduating the program.

Personal Finance: 3 hours – Students learn the importance of budgeting, saving and managing their finances. Students learn how to manage their own personal budgets and gain a better understanding of financially planning for the future.

Basic Electricity/Electrical Fabrication: 78-hours – Students learn basic electricity and electrical fabrication. Time is equally divided between basic electricity – AC/DC circuits and electrical fabrication. Students learn the fundamentals of electricity, basic electrical circuits, electrical system wiring, circuit protection and conduit bending and threading.

Electric Relay Control/Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs):  36-hours – Students gain understanding of electric relay control and PLCs. Students will understand control logic and sequencing control as well as programming and wiring PLCs.

Mechanical Fabrication:  36-hours – Students gain an understanding of mechanical fabrication. Students have experience with but not limited to: threaded fasteners, wrenches, screwdrivers, torque wrenches, etc., as well as pneumatic and hydraulic system fabrication.

Biology passing grade on Keystone Exam.

PSYC110 Introduction to Psychology completion and earning a C or higher. Introduction to Psychology is the scientific study of the psychological factors which influence the behavior of individual organisms, both animal and human.

EDUC100 Foundations of Education completion with a C or higher. This course is primarily for students interested in pursuing a career in education. This course provides a survey of the history and philosophy of education with emphasis on current problems in education, on significant educational innovations, and on the school as a social institution. Students complete five hours of observation.

EDUC160 Introduction to Exceptionalities completion with a C or higher. This course provides an overview of the different categories of exceptional learners. d22e52c5-24c5-4cd8-a24d-03ae1c46c69b.description: All students who have completed the required core and elective class hours are invited to take this final step in receiving their Certificate of Completion for the Floral Design Program. During the final class you will receive your Certificate from Bucks, your completed evaluation and, if possible, recommendation to move on to the CFD exam.

bdcb204f-91a7-4c9f-b94b-0cc110a2174d.description: This course will prepare students to understand the nature of projects and project management by providing the foundation for understanding the broad concepts of successful initiating, planning, executing, controlling, monitoring, and closing out of projects. Case studies are used to illustrate the principles and tools of project management as a process.
bdcb204f-91a7-4c9f-b94b-0cc110a2174d.name: Foundations in Project Management

badge_template_activities.title: The student will describe the key project management concepts and their importance to projects and organizations.

The student will be able to describe and demonstrate the project management activities for properly initiating, planning, executing, controlling and closing a project in accordance with PMI guidelines.
The student will be able to explain and apply the main project scheduling concepts.
The student will be able to explain and apply project control methodologies.
The student will understand people-skills for effective project management and team leadership.

36cce454-696e-45b0-8021-98999df40bfc.description: This beginner English course provides an introduction to the language. Students in this course develop an understanding of basic English phrases, vocabulary and grammar. This course is designed to develop students' reading, writing, listening and speaking skills at a beginning English level.
36cce454-696e-45b0-8021-98999df40bfc.name: Intermediate English Level 1 (2A)

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Within the Four Domains of English (Listening, Reading, Speaking, & Writing) the student will be able to: 1. Correctly use conjunctions 2. Correctly conjugate & use be going to to express future actions; 3. Correctly use and place adverbs of degree & frequency in a sentence; 4. Correctly conjugate & use the present continuous tense 5. Correctly conjugate & use the simple past 6. Use appropriate vocabulary to discuss physical descriptions of people, clothing, chores, repairs, & life milestones.
Student will complete a final assessment through Four Domains of English (Listening, Reading, Speaking, and Writing) requiring a 70% or better to be successful.

be9dabaf-9a18-4f5b-8363-622c66d3e82a.description: This intermediate English class provides students with grammatical skills such as the future tense and critical vocabulary for use in the workplace, community and as preparation for students interested in transitioning into college-level ESL programs. This course is designed to develop students' reading, writing, listening and speaking skills at the intermediate level.
be9dabaf-9a18-4f5b-8363-622c66d3e82a.name: Intermediate English Level 2 (2B)

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Within the Four Domains of English (Listening, Reading, Speaking, & Writing) the student will be able to: 1. Conjugate & use used to; 2. Conjugate & use the present continuous for future actions; 3. Use modals to show probability, certainty & regret; 4. Use transitive & intransitive phrasal verbs; 5. Conjugate & use the present perfect tense with ever & never; 6. Use comparative adjectives; and 7. To effectively discuss educational/career goals, employment habits, travel, & purchasing issues.
Student will complete a final assessment through Four Domains of English (Listening, Reading, Speaking, and Writing) requiring a 70% or better to be successful.

f8cb92da-3cda-4b55-a5ce-4afa6af98a9c.description: This intermediate English class provides students with grammatical skills such as gerunds and infinitives as well as critical vocabulary for use in the workplace, community and for students transitioning into college-level ESL programs. This course is designed to develop students' reading, writing, listening and speaking skills at a high intermediate level.
f8cb92da-3cda-4b55-a5ce-4afa6af98a9c.name: Intermediate English Level 3 (2C)

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Within the Four Domains of English (Listening, Reading, Speaking, & Writing) the student will be able to: 1. Conjugate & use will, be going to & the present continuous to show future actions; 2. Use gerunds & infinitives; 3. Correctly use the simple past & the present perfect; 4. Create tag questions; 5. Convert quotes to reported speech; and 6. To effectively discuss short & long-term goals, interview skills, cultural traditions, workplace communication, housing & natural disasters.
Student will complete a final assessment through Four Domains of English (Listening, Reading, Speaking, and Writing) requiring a 70% or better to be successful.

60eeb414-c981-42b3-b28c-e41803ee0815.description: Students will be able to advance their knowledge and skills in floral design with this intermediate course. They will have opportunities to design larger arrangements using more complex techniques. They will learn to use some of the most common design techniques including: mille de fleur, Biedermeier, phoenix, and waterfall designs.
60eeb414-c981-42b3-b28c-e41803ee0815.name: Intermediate Floral Design

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: The student will be able to: 1) Identify the current floral design “design styles” and the distinguished characteristics of each style.
The student will be able to: 2) Identify those given flower, foliage and potted plants used in commercial floristry.
The student will be able to: 3) Recall the definition of each principle and element of design.
The student will be able to: 4) Identify how each principle or element of design is created and used in floral design.
The student will be able to: 5) Analyze & critique floral designs in order to determine proper use of the principles of design.
The student will be able to: 6) Recall major aspects of color and color theory.
The student will be able to: 7) Design & identify design techniques.
The student will be able to: 8) Determine & implement the appropriate floral mechanics for completing any arrangement.

6787e617-3340-474a-8884-f02e2f5d3ac1.description: The earner of this badge has completed training to basic fire training (EL22) including an overview of the fire service, fire service history, it’s mission and organization, firefighter safety, personal protective equipment, tools, communications, work areas, and backing apparatus. This is the first of four levels (courses) in the curriculum.
6787e617-3340-474a-8884-f02e2f5d3ac1.name: Introduction to the Fire Service (FSC-3459)

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks County Community College

40d36c00-5ab5-4a32-8dd1-a56b277fc735.description: This course will focus on process based audits with exposure to live audit scenarios, and the value to the business through internal audits using industry best practices. At the end of the course, students will acquire the needed skills to be able to conduct Internal Audits in any company and establish/verify that the QMS of their organization is compliant to ISO 9001:2015.
40d36c00-5ab5-4a32-8dd1-a56b277fc735.name: ISO 9001:2015 Internal Auditor Training

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Have basic reading and writing skills as well as basic aptitude for mathematical statics.
Have professional experience in work and business processes.
Complete Internal Auditor Certification Training course in accordance with ISO 9001:2015 Requirements.
Successfully complete the Internal Auditor Certification course assessment examination.

bd133760-c3a0-42f2-bb57-8efb4c251a83.description: This course focuses on Lean Six Sigma Methodology and how to effectively lead a continuous improvement project. The students work on a project from their industry and choose a key business issue impacting the company's performance. Application of lean six sigma tools to a practical problem provides the knowledge and the skills to make a difference to the company by focusing on cost savings. Coursework strictly adheres to ASQ Body of Knowledge and prepare them for the global certification exam.
bd133760-c3a0-42f2-bb57-8efb4c251a83.name: Lean Six Sigma Black Belt Certification

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Have basic reading and writing skills as well as basic aptitude for mathematical statics.
Have professional experience in work and business processes.
Complete Lean Six Sigma Black Belt Certification Training course in accordance with American Society for Quality (ASQ) Body of Knowledge.
Successfully complete the Black Belt Certification course assessment examination.

skills.name: Lean Six Sigma Black Belt Certificate Program

cd3e38da-313a-434c-91e1-1f9fb28eb4d0.description: This course focuses on Lean and Six Sigma philosophy and how to champion the implementation of an organization's Lean Six Sigma program. Students will learn Lean Six Sigma methodology, how to properly apply Lean and Six Sigma tools, and how to effectively integrate these tools to improve business & production processes, for measurable positive impact to the bottom line. Coursework strictly adheres to ASQ Body of Knowledge and prepares them for the global certification exam.
cd3e38da-313a-434c-91e1-1f9fb28eb4d0.name: Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Certification

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks County Community College

Successfully complete the Green Belt Certification course assessment examination.

dfa36350-9f86-491b-9edf-dd66d903f71b.description: This course is designed to prepare you for pre-employment as a Locomotive Engineer or Conductor candidate at a public transportation provider or freight railroad. The earner of this Badge has successfully completed the basic Railroad course. The learner gained knowledge in NORAC, Hazmat, Safety, and freight operating rules. Also, studied the Federal Railroad Administration rules and regulations, especially, rules pertaining to rest (Hours of service).
dfa36350-9f86-491b-9edf-dd66d903f71b.name: Locomotive Engineer & Conductor Program

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: The student will have knowledge of Railroad structure: parts and layout of the Track: - Different types of equipment both passenger and freight railroads - Varies types of the signals and signal systems, such as ABS, INT, CSS, DCS and PTC.

The student will understand Railroad Assignments and roles (Engineer, Conductor, Assistant Conductor, Dispatcher, Yardmaster, and several different types of management positions). Also, different types of assignments (Yard, Local and Road).

The student will understand the Operating Rules: General rules and regulations - Inspection of equipment and train movement rules - Different types of air test for both trains and engines - Radio and electronic communication rules - Track Car and equipment rules.
The student will understand the different classes of hazmat, switching, placement rules, and FRA restrictions. Also, overview of Emergency Response Guide.

6882eba6-cdfb-4cd6-95ae-8c8eab36e001.description: Participants use multimedia resources, practice the process of of creating effective assignments that require students to apply research skills, composition skills, and technological competency. Participants engage in activities to develop an understanding of the framework for information literacy as it relates to multimedia projects, researching content, and assignment design.
6882eba6-cdfb-4cd6-95ae-8c8eab36e001.name: Multimedia Literacy Institute

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Participants create an assignment demonstrating their understanding of the Association of College and Research Libraries’ Framework for Information Literacy as it relates to multimedia research projects.  Participants effectively access, analyze, evaluate and use multimedia resources appropriate to their own disciplines.  Participants create and assess multimedia resource rich assignments for their courses.

994e2994-5e56-4e75-b844-b3d8e028b677.description: The course satisfies the requirement for new applicants & renewals. Students learn the powers, duties and obligations of a Notary, how to become a Notary in Pennsylvania, how to identify clients, how to keep accurate records and understand the new requirements under RULONA. Topics covered include: who can be a Notary in PA, what documents you can notarize, when can you notarize a document, where can you notarize a document, why do you notarize a document and how do you notarize a document?
994e2994-5e56-4e75-b844-b3d8e028b677.name: Notary

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Concepts covered include: How to identify clients and keep accurate records and to understand the Commonwealth’s process for applying for a Notary License. Students will learn about the mandatory bond requirement and what insurance is available for Notaries as well as what equipment is needed to complete the duties of a Notary.

The student will learn the duties of a notary which include acknowledgement, oaths, verifications on oath or affirmation, witnessing or attesting a signature, witnessing or attesting a signature, certifying or attesting a copy of depositing, and noting a protest of a negotiable instrument.

a4d99672-279d-4366-8cc6-a202523a639e.description: The earner of this badge has completed training in various types of workplace hazardous, safety PPE, and regulating laws and standards. This program is designed to follow the OSHA Regulations found in the Code of Federal Regulations.
a4d99672-279d-4366-8cc6-a202523a639e.name: OSHA 30-Hour: General Industry

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Meet all of the objectives of the training course set forth by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration.

465d9e27-a6f2-4b61-9fae-5c402c4125cb.description: Students establish a strong introductory framework for understanding and practicing in the paralegal field including civil procedure, the function of the courts, and legal research. Students also gain an understanding of the scope and importance of business law and its fundamental principles, concepts, and rules.
465d9e27-a6f2-4b61-9fae-5c402c4125cb.name: Paralegal Studies

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: English 11-1
Government and Development of Public Policy

LAWS100 Introduction to Paralegal Studies completion earning a C or better. This is a survey course encompassing the varied duties of a paralegal as practiced in Bucks, Montgomery and Philadelphia counties. This course describes work done by paralegals in the following areas: civil procedure, administrative law, legal research, and legal writing.

MGMT 130 Business Law completion earning a C or better. This course examines the fundamentals of Business Law, the legal process and environment within which individuals and business operate, and the relationship of law, business, and the individual. Topics include the basic elements of a contract, the Uniform Commercial Code, and provision on sales and negotiable instruments.
Completion of an additional paralegal studies course at Bucks County Community College. Must earn a C or higher.

09c6cb2c-81b1-437d-8881-013ebdf91830.description: This course is designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve their pronunciation of English. Students in this course are able to practice their pronunciation of sounds in American English and to address specific challenges with respect to accent and pronunciation.
09c6cb2c-81b1-437d-8881-013ebdf91830.name: Pronunciation & Accent Reduction

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: PREREQUISITE: MUST HAVE COMPLETED 1B (Or have an intermediate English proficiency level)

Students will be able to: 1. Demonstrate an understanding the written and phonetic correlation in the English language; 2. Recognize and produce phonemes which are difficult or non-existent in their native language; 3. Demonstrate a more native-like command over intonation; and 4. Recognize and produce various tones of voice to fit various emotional needs.
Student will be holistically assessed to determine if they have satisfactorily mastered the material/met the learning outcomes.

fb46f7c8-90a6-4245-9fb3-92358de2b939.description: This ServSafe training course will prepares you to take the official ServSafe Certification exam. ServSafe training is designed by food service and safety professionals, and it meets the requirements of state and federal laws and regulations. You will learn: the importance of food safety handling, forms of contaminations, hazards in the flow of food, purchasing, receiving & storage of food as well as additional topics.
fb46f7c8-90a6-4245-9fb3-92358de2b939.name: ServSafe

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Individuals who complete the program and pass the accredited certification exam are recognized as Certified Food Safety Managers. This class is delivered in two 4-hour training sessions. The on-line proctored exam, with review will be administered on the third day.

At the conclusion of the training, the student will be versed in understanding the importance of food safety handling. Understanding forms of contaminations, the safe food handler – personal hygiene, hazards in the flow of food - preventing cross contamination, purchasing, receiving and storage, food preparation – thawing and cooking practices, guidelines for serving safe food, food safety management systems, facilities and pest management and cleaning and sanitizing.

bb0402d0-1fb3-4401-8c47-0047effabbd7.description: Students acquire the skills and knowledge to plan, create, and implement effective social media and digital marketing campaigns for small business, corporations, government agencies or non-profit organizations.
bb0402d0-1fb3-4401-8c47-0047effabbd7.name: Social Media and Digital Marketing Studies

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: COLL101 College Success Seminar completion earning a C or higher. Through self-exploration and group interaction, the seminar facilitates students' academic and social integration into the College community and helps build academic success strategies. Students gain knowledge of the College's resources, services, policies, and procedures, and explore various major and career opportunities to develop an academic plan.

VAMM100 Digital Imaging completion earning a C or higher. This studio course presents in-depth techniques for image creation and manipulation using current software applications. Students explore peripherals, file formats, resolution requirements, media storage, and digital photo processing. Emphasis is on image-making methods used to create raster and vector graphics for print and the web.

VAMM110 Web and Interactive Design completion earning a C or higher. This course is an introduction to the XHTML coding and techniques used to create websites. Students learn to design and develop interactive websites using both editors and hand coding skills. Project management and design skills are introduced. The semester culminates in the development of a website.

MKTG230 Digital Marketing compleiton earning a C or higher. This course explores social media marketing principles and best practices for using social media for business, reputation management, and online community building. Students analyze current social networking sites, learning how to use social media to create meaningful relationships with customers, clients, and colleagues. The relevant legal/ethical ramifications are studied.

MKTG220 Digital Marketing completion earning a C or higher. This course examines the basic principles and concepts underlying the use of digital information and communication technology by organizations and consumers. It reviews critical success factors and best practices central to the effectiveness of digital tools and social media.

MKTG280 Marketing Internship completion earning a C or higher. Students participate in an on-the-job experience and observation in a field directly related to their academic preparation and career objectives in marketing/retail. Students periodically review actual experience and observation in the light of theory and skills learned academically with a College Coordinator.

Have Rope Technical Rescuer Awareness Level Certification (IFSAC and/or ProBoard) in accordance with NFPA 1006.
Have Rope Technical Rescuer Operations Level Certification (IFSAC and/or ProBoard) in accordance with NFPA 1006.
Complete Trench Technical Rescuer Operations Level training in accordance with NFPA 1006.
Successfully complete the Professional Certification assessment examination.

6ad1fe0c-cfe1-476f-8291-40039e02667c.description: From Brides and Grooms, to Moms, Flower Girls and that Great Uncle who's never missed a birthday, we'll walk through the best ways to create all of the personal flowers for the wedding day, along with techniques to add that creative and personal touch for each unique client.
6ad1fe0c-cfe1-476f-8291-40039e02667c.name: Weddings I: A Personal Touch

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: The student will be able to: 1) Identify, by common or Latin names, those given flower, foliage and potted plants used in commercial floristry.
The student will be able to: 2) Recall the definition of each principle and element of design.
The student will be able to: 3) Identify how each principle or element of design is created and used in floral design.
The student will be able to: 4) Analyze & critique floral designs in order to determine proper use of the principles of design.
The student will be able to: 5) Recall major aspects of color and color theory.

The student will be able to: 6) Synthesize given information to be able to complete an assigned project of an oval centerpiece, hand wired bridal bouquet, foam bouquet holder, hand-tied bridal bouquet.
The student will be able to: 7) Demonstrate proper wiring techniques for given flowers such as clutch wiring, cross-pierce wiring, hairpin wiring & insertion wiring.
The student will be able to: 8) Determine and implement the most appropriate floral mechanic for completing any of the arrangements.
The student will be able to: 9) Demonstrate the proper techniques for creating well developed principles and elements of design for the required arrangement.
The student will be able to: 10) Analyze given parameters and information, then determine the appropriate style and design shape for complete the assigned design project.
The student will be able to: 11) Identify the types of attaching, binding & foam mechanics and their application to professional floral design.
The student will be able to: 12) Identify different types of flowers to wear and flowers to carry.
The student will be able to: 13) Identify the different gauges of florist wire.

c58fa1bd-1f0b-4976-881b-001e5aab919b.description: We're going to the chapel and the church, and the Cathedral! Then we'll explore the techniques and mechanics used to create inspiring reception décor.
c58fa1bd-1f0b-4976-881b-001e5aab919b.name: Weddings II: Ceremony & Celebrations
